alert.note: Alert for Gogebic (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 7:47AM EDT until April 16 at 7:46AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .Warm temperatures and snow melt will cause the river flows to become high. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Black River near Bessemer. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Which is flood stage...water impacts low lying areas of properties along Black River Road and Hedberg Road * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CDT Saturday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 4.6 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 04/12/2001. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1100 PM EDT /1000 PM CDT/.
